p: Until 2019 there were two known coronaviruses that had also epidemically infected the human population. SARS-CoV appeared in 2002 in China's Guangdong province and spread throughout Southeast Asia. The last confirmed case was in September 2003. This virus infected about 8000 people and caused 774 deaths (9.5% fatality rate). Its infectivity (R0) rate was about 4, which facilitated its rapid spread. 2, 3
